data.title: Goodbye, Children: Isaac Hayes Dead
data.meta_description:

data.text:
http://www.cnn.com/2008/SHOWBIZ/Music/08/10/hayes.obit/

Soul singer and arranger Isaac Hayes, who won Grammy awards and an Oscar for the theme from the 1971 action film "Shaft," has died, sheriff's officials in Memphis, Tennessee, reported Sunday.

Relatives found Hayes, 65, unconscious in his home next to a still-running treadmill, said Steve Schular, a spokesman for the Shelby County Sheriff's Department.

Paramedics attempted to revive him and took him to a hospital, where he was pronounced dead shortly after 2 p.m., the sheriff's department said.

R.I.P.

RocketSledFight said:

RIP.

Famous people who I like need to stop dying for a little while.

I know. Next year's Oscar's obituary tribute will run an hour long at this rate...

I guess it doesn't matter too much then that he left South Park over "making fun" of Scientology. Can anyone say hypocrite? He would've been leaving soon enough anyway.

I'm sure he was a good guy and all that.

WillKill4Food said:

People die. All the time. It's nothing strange. Sh!t happens.

Indeed. It's true.

*inserts more mumbo jumbo*

Agent Crab said:

Indeed. It's true.

*inserts more mumbo jumbo*

I was just replying to Nurhachi's post. There's nothing wierd about it, it just happened.

It's random.

Every man dies at one point in his life. You just have to make sure that you live during your life.

No Ticket said:

I guess it doesn't matter too much then that he left South Park over "making fun" of Scientology.

Exactly.

You should be able to make fun of yourself.
